documentation.name: Apply
documentation.summary: Apply a function across an matrix or array.

details.p: The apply function takes an array (an n-dimentional rectangular datasets) as an input object and applies the function specified either by the 'Select Function' box or any arbitrary function in the 'Function' box. Any additional parameters to the function can be input in the 'Additional Parameters' line.
Users can use either the 'To' box or the 'Array Index' box to specify the index on which the function will be applied.

The result is an (n-1)-dimentional array containing the results of the function applied across the array.
For example:
Apply the function max across the following array, with index 1 (Rows).
[[1, 2, 3] [4, 5, 6] [7, 8, 9]]
Results in this vector.
[3, 6, 9]
While applied across the columns would result in: [7, 8, 9].

parameter.name: Select Function
parameter.description: Select the function to apply across the data.

parameter.name: Function
parameter.description: Input a custon function to apply. This will override the function indicated in the Select Function area.

parameter.name: Additional Parameters
parameter.description: Parameters to apply to the function beyond just the data. Please see the specified function for help on what these options might be.

parameter.name: To
parameter.description: Select what margin to apply the function to, rows applies across the rows, columns applies across the columns.

parameter.name: Array Index
parameter.description: Select the margin to apply the function over if the array is larger than two dimentional. This overrides the selections in the To area.
